healthy.translation[0].definitions[0].de: physically strong and not likely to become ill or weak
healthy.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I’ve always been perfectly healthy until now.
healthy.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Her face had a healthy glow.
All of our kids have healthy appetites (=they like to eat a lot).
healthy.translation[0].definitions[3].de: used to describe an attitude, feeling, or behaviour that is natural, normal, and sensible
healthy.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I don’t think it’s healthy for her to spend so much time alone.
a healthy disrespect for silly regulations
healthy.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a healthy company, society, relationship, economy etc is working effectively and successfully
healthy.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: a healthy economy with a well-trained workforce
healthy.translation[0].definitions[5].de: large and showing that someone is successful – used about amounts of money
healthy.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: healthy
having good health
A good diet keeps you healthy.
They tested the drug on healthy volunteers.
well
used especially when describing or asking about how someone feels or looks
I don’t feel well.
How was James – did he look well?
used in a reply to a question about your health, or when talking about someone else’s health. Use fine  only in replies or statements, not in questions
‘Hi, Tom, how are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks.’
She had a bad cold, but she’s fine now.
all right/OK
not ill or injured. These expressions are very commonly used in everyday spoken English
You look pale – are you feeling all right?
He’s had an accident but he’s OK.
better
less ill than you were, or no longer ill
I’m feeling a lot better now.
Don’t come back to school until you’re better.
fit
healthy, especially because you exercise regularly
She keeps fit by cycling everywhere.
Police officers have to be physically fit and have good eyesight.
in (good) shape
healthy and fit
Jogging keeps me in pretty good shape.
robust
healthy and strong, and not likely to become ill
He had a robust constitution (=a strong and healthy body).
robust plants
a robust girl, wearing a thick woollen sweater
be/look a picture of health
to look very healthy
She looked a picture of health as she posed for the cameras.
healthy.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a healthy organization, system, economy etc is working effectively and successfully
healthy.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Banks should invest only in financially healthy companies.
healthy.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a healthy amount of something is large
healthy.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: They are predicting healthy profits on the shares.
I hope to see a healthy return on my investment.
Industry needs ahealthy supply of graduates.
